overview: 1 Peter encourages suffering believers scattered throughout Asia Minor. They are called to hope in Christ's return, submit to authorities, and rejoice in trials as they follow Christ's example of suffering.

verses.text: Casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you.
But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for his own possession, that you may proclaim the excellencies of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
But in your hearts honor Christ the Lord as holy, always being prepared to make a defense to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you; yet do it with gentleness and respect.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! According to his great mercy, he has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.

passages.title: A Living Hope
passages.summary: Through Christ's resurrection, believers have a living hope and an inheritance that cannot perish, spoil, or fade.

passages.title: Christ's Example in Suffering
passages.summary: Christ suffered for us, leaving an example to follow—He didn't retaliate but entrusted Himself to God.

facts.text: Peter wrote this letter from 'Babylon' (5:13), probably code for Rome, shortly before his martyrdom.
The word 'suffering' appears 16 times in this short letter—Peter knows what he's talking about.
1 Peter 3:15 is the foundation for Christian apologetics—giving a reason for our hope.

figures.name: Peter
figures.description: The apostle who denied Christ now writes boldly about following Him through suffering, soon to face his own martyrdom.

figures.name: Silvanus (Silas)
figures.description: Peter's secretary who helped write this letter and was also Paul's missionary companion.

videos.title: 1 Peter Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores hope and holiness in the midst of suffering.
